subject: Personal Finance
title: The Subprime Mortgage Disaster
description: A quick, practical guide to The Subprime Mortgage Disaster.

hook.text: Banks gave mortgages to people who couldn't repay. Then they sold the risk and pretended it was gone.

buildup.text: Subprime loans targeted borrowers with poor credit, offering low 'teaser' rates that later spiked.

discovery.text: Banks bundled these risky loans into securities and sold them as safe investments worldwide.

twist.text: When housing prices fell, defaults cascaded. The 'safe' securities turned out to be worthless.

climax.text: Lehman Brothers collapsed. The global economy nearly followed. Taxpayers funded the bailouts.

punchline.text: Bad loans crashed the global economy.

quiz.question: What were subprime mortgages?
options: Loans given to borrowers with poor credit at high risk
